snippet.title: SC2067: Lifestyle the key to Coast's bright future
snippet.content:
NEW arrivals Chris and Lauren Graffen's outlook on life is brightening as they wind down from their former hectic existence.
A Sunshine Coast holiday late last year was enough to convince them it was time to leave Melbourne for sunny shores.
They have loved the community feel of their new town of Coolum since arriving about four months ago.
"Our three-year-old, she has changed completely since we moved," Mrs Graffen said.
"She has come out of her shell and I think it is because of where we are."
She said the differences in lifestyle, which stem from the differences in weather, were really noticeable.
"We were absolutely gobsmacked about how many people just walk around the streets.
"The Sunshine Coast is really different.
"It has its own little personality."
from on .
The relaxed, friendly, community feel is something she and her husband hope is retained 50 years from now.
"I hope it stays the same," Mr Graffen said.
"Obviously it is not going to."
He hoped the region wouldn't over-capitalise on tourism, like the Gold Coast.
"It (the Gold Coast) is a great place to holiday but we wouldn't want to live there."
The refrigeration mechanic said life in Melbourne's suburbs revolved around work and stress.
"Down there I was working ridiculous hours and didn't have enough time growing up with the kids.
"Up here it is more of a lifestyle."
